intro: Parnassia longipetala var. longipetala, commonly known as the long-petaled parnassia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its striking white, star-shaped flowers with a distinctive yellowish center. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as meadows and forest floors. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the stems are often covered in fine, soft hairs. It is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, temperate climates.
